Message.Title: Volume Shift
Message.Msg: It looks like Apple and Google will move market cap dollars to Yahoo. The inevitable volume shift coupled with fewer shares for sale with the buyback, and you sense a movement in Yahoo that has been pent up for a long time. Yahoo market cap can easily be $80B.

Topic.Title: Sad that this guy has no time to even watch a movie but why don't they....

Message.Msg: Yes, well my life is on the up-swing. And i hate to fly with someone other than myself at the controls. But it beats a long swim. Before the financial melt down the airports were packed with travelers, but i have seen a serious decline since. In 06 HK was almost impossible to walk thru, several months back i went thru and it was deserted. I have seen a steady fall in travelers since the financial thing. Canada has always been good to me and i look forward to visiting next year. More work to do there. I have never visited other than Windsor, Watterloo, and the Toranto area. But now i get to expand all the way north. I am looking forward to it.

Topic.Title: Sad that this guy has no time to even watch a movie but why don't they....

Message.Msg: Canada is a great place to visit. I especially like the Old Strathcona section of Edmonton. Of course, I haven't been there since 91, but I do have great memories. Much better than my time in Hull, Quebec or Sudbury, Ontario. Don't miss Ottawa and a do day trip over the Lion Gate bridge in Vancouver, BC then rent a boat and tour around the inner passage. Oh if you want a rail trip. Go from Vancouver to Calgary through a tunnel the corkscrews up through the Canadian Rockies. Don't go Calgary to Vancouver, then the trip is at night.
